service.title: Proof Key for Code Exchange by OAuth Public Clients
service.documentation: OAuth 2.0 public clients utilizing the Authorization Code Grant are susceptible to the authorization code interception attack. This specification describes the attack as well as a technique to mitigate against the threat through the use of Proof Key for Code Exchange (PKCE, pronounced "pixy").

pkce-code-challenge-method.documentation: The plain transformation is for compatibility with existing deployments and for constrained environments that can't use the S256 transformation.
Clients are permitted to use "plain" only if they cannot support "S256" for some technical reason and know via out-of-band configuration that the server supports "plain".

oauth-parameter.documentation: Code verifier transformation method is "S256" or "plain". Defaults to "plain" if not present in the request.
